channel.title: HELP! PLEASE! wrong with the runserver.bat! :s
channel.description:
okay, here's the thing! :s
when i press the "runserver" a box appears and dissapears so fast that i can't read it, and when i try to open my client it says java isen't a shortcut or something like that!
PLEASE HELP FAST!
thank you.

item.title: HELP! PLEASE! wrong with the runserver.bat! :s
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

durial12:

Jave isn’t a commando. But the chances are its not a recognsied command. Just download and install JDK (GOOOOGLE) then set your environment variables (the link above) and it should be fixed.

Java isn’t located in the JDK… Javac is.

Read full topic
item.source: HELP! PLEASE! wrong with the runserver.bat! :s

item.title: HELP! PLEASE! wrong with the runserver.bat! :s
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

You have to set your environment variables. Follow this tutorial: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,372873.0.html

Read full topic
item.source: HELP! PLEASE! wrong with the runserver.bat! :s

item.title: HELP! PLEASE! wrong with the runserver.bat! :s
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“relmitos, post:2, topic:321678”]Put “pause” at the end of your run.bat

@echo off
java …
pause[/quote]

or change the java version.

Read full topic
